verses.esv: 13 Brothers, I do not consider that I have made it my own. But one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead, 14 I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.kjv: 13 Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before, 14 I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.niv: 13 Brothers, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, 14 I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.

verses.esv:
32   Can a virgin forget her ornaments,
    or a bride her attire?
  Yet my people have forgotten me
    days without number.
verses.kjv: 32 Can a maid forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
verses.niv: 32 Does a maiden forget her jewelry, a bride her wedding ornaments? Yet my people have forgotten me, days without number.

verses.esv: 22 But be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves. 23 For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man who looks intently at his natural face in a mirror. 24 For he looks at himself and goes away and at once forgets what he was like. 25 But the one who looks into the perfect law, the law of liberty, and perseveres, being no hearer who forgets but a doer who acts, he will be blessed in his doing.
verses.kjv: 22 But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves. 23 For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass: 24 For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was. 25 But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.
verses.niv: 22 Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says. 23 Anyone who listens to the word but does not do what it says is like a man who looks at his face in a mirror 24 and, after looking at himself, goes away and immediately forgets what he looks like. 25 But the man who looks intently into the perfect law that gives freedom, and continues to do this, not forgetting what he has heard, but doing it--he will be blessed in what he does.

verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

verses.esv: 17 Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.
verses.kjv: 17 Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.
verses.niv: 17 Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has gone, the new has come!

verses.esv:
12   For I will be merciful toward their iniquities,
    and I will remember their sins no more.”
verses.kjv: 12 For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.niv: 12 For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more."

verses.esv:
25   “I, I am he
    who blots out your transgressions for my own sake,
    and I will not remember your sins.
verses.kjv: 25 I, even I, am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.
verses.niv: 25 "I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions, for my own sake, and remembers your sins no more.

verses.esv: 34 And no longer shall each one teach his neighbor and each his brother, saying, ‘Know the LORD,’ for they shall all know me, from the least of them to the greatest, declares the LORD. For I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.”
verses.kjv: 34 And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the LORD: for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the LORD; for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.
verses.niv: 34 No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying, 'Know the LORD,' because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest," declares the LORD. "For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more."

verses.esv: 8:1 There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
verses.kjv: 1 There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
verses.niv: 1 Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus,

verses.esv: 13 Brothers, I do not consider that I have made it my own. But one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead,
verses.kjv: 13 Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,
verses.niv: 13 Brothers, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead,

verses.esv:
18   “Remember not the former things,
    nor consider the things of old.
19   Behold, I am doing a new thing;
    now it springs forth, do you not perceive it?
  I will make a way in the wilderness
    and rivers in the desert.
verses.kjv: 18 Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old. 19 Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.
verses.niv: 18 "Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. 19 See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the desert and streams in the wasteland.

verses.esv:
17 then he adds,

  “I will remember their sins and their lawless deeds no more.”
verses.kjv: 17 And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.niv: 17 Then he adds: "Their sins and lawless acts I will remember no more."

verses.esv:
18   “Remember not the former things,
    nor consider the things of old.
verses.kjv: 18 Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old.
verses.niv: 18 "Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past.

verses.esv: 13 bearing with one another and, if one has a complaint against another, forgiving each other; as the Lord has forgiven you, so you also must forgive.
verses.kjv: 13 Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.niv: 13 Bear with each other and forgive whatever grievances you may have against one another. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.

verses.esv: 20 I have been crucified with Christ. It is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
verses.kjv: 20 I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.
verses.niv: 20 I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.

verses.esv: 28 And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.
verses.kjv: 28 And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
verses.niv: 28 And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.

verses.esv: 12:1 I appeal to you therefore, brothers, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, which is your spiritual worship. 2 Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
verses.kjv: 1 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service. 2 And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
verses.niv: 1 Therefore, I urge you, brothers, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to God--this is your spiritual act of worship. 2 Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is--his good, pleasing and perfect will.

verses.esv: 7 Have nothing to do with irreverent, silly myths. Rather train yourself for godliness;
verses.kjv: 7 But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.
verses.niv: 7 Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives' tales; rather, train yourself to be godly.

verses.esv: 12 Not that I have already obtained this or am already perfect, but I press on to make it my own, because Christ Jesus has made me his own.
verses.kjv: 12 Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.
verses.niv: 12 Not that I have already obtained all this, or have already been made perfect, but I press on to take hold of that for which Christ Jesus took hold of me.

verses.esv: 62 Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.kjv: 62 And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
verses.niv: 62 Jesus replied, "No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God."

verses.esv: 23 And he said to all, “If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.
verses.kjv: 23 And he said to them all, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.niv: 23 Then he said to them all: "If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.

verses.esv:
12   as far as the east is from the west,
    so far does he remove our transgressions from us.
verses.kjv: 12 As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
verses.niv: 12 as far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.

verses.esv: 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv: 38 and you shall not forget the covenant that I have made with you. You shall not fear other gods,
verses.kjv: 38 And the covenant that I have made with you ye shall not forget; neither shall ye fear other gods.
verses.niv: 38 Do not forget the covenant I have made with you, and do not worship other gods.

verses.esv: 11 Not that I am speaking of being in need, for I have learned in whatever situation I am to be content.
verses.kjv: 11 Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content.
verses.niv: 11 I am not saying this because I am in need, for I have learned to be content whatever the circumstances.
